🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝙎𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙘𝙝 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝙊𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙨 & 𝙂𝙧𝙚𝙚𝙣𝙝𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝘽𝙤𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨Since my last work experience, I have embarked on an enriching journey that has instilled in me the invaluable lessons of humility, patience, resilience, and the courage to continuously acquire new knowledge within the dynamic technology industry.I would also really appreciate any support or referrals from my LinkedIn network! If you know of any opportunities or can introduce me to someone in your network, please reach out. It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt

🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝙎𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙘𝙝 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝙊𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙨 & 𝙂𝙧𝙚𝙚𝙣𝙝𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝘽𝙤𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨Since my last work experience, I have embarked on an enriching journey that has instilled in me the invaluable lessons of humility, patience, resilience, and the courage to continuously acquire new knowledge within the dynamic technology industry.I would also really appreciate any support or referrals from my LinkedIn network! If you know of any opportunities or can introduce me to someone in your network, please reach out. It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. Strong Population & Economic GrowthDubai is attracting global talent, wealthy individuals, and businessesPopulation grows by hundreds of thousands annually → High housing demand supports price appreciation and rental stability.4. World-Class Safety and StabilityRanked #2 in global safety (Numbeo 2024)Neutral and stable government, far from global conflicts → Dubai is seen as a safe haven for global wealth.5. Eligibility for Long-Term Residency (Golden Visa)Property investment of AED 2M or more qualifies for a 10-year Golden VisaEnables long-term residence, bank access, and family sponsorship6. Global Hub with Excellent ConnectivityDubai International Airport is one of the busiest in the worldEasy access to Europe, Asia, and Africa → Perfect for investors seeking international flexibility.7. Strong Currency Pegged to USDThe UAE Dirham (AED) is pegged to the US Dollar → Helps protect against currency depreciation and inflation, especially for investors from countries like Japan.🌟 In Summary:Zero taxes + high rental returns + global city with safety & growth → These factors make Dubai a top choice for international property investors.hashtag#ドバイ hashtag#ドバイ不動産 hashtag#不動産投資 hashtag#現地ドバイ不動産屋さん hashtag#世界中から人物が集まる場所hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Dubairealestate hashtag#Investment hashtag#Bridesandalliesrealestate

ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt

🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

To be removed from our communication, click here to unsubscribe". I think this is an infected link that might give them access to your device. Please be aware of such emails and check the sources before you click any links.

The demand for ultra-luxury homes in supertall towers across the Middle East is reaching new heights – literally.⁣From Dubai’s record-breaking skyscrapers to Saudi Arabia’s revival of the Jeddah Tower (set to be the world’s tallest at over 1,000 metres), ambitious mega-projects are reshaping the region’s skyline – and attracting investors from around the globe.⁣As Mirwais Azizi, founder and chairman of Azizi Developments, told The National:⁣“A lot of people want to have some property here in Dubai — from India, Arab countries … now the Europeans, a lot of them are purchasing here because of the security, good leadership, and the stable market.”⁣Dubai’s real estate boom continues to be fuelled by smart government policies such as:– Residency permits for retirees and remote workers– The expansion of the 10-year Golden Visa program– Diversification of the UAE economy, making it one of the region’s most attractive investment destinations⁣According to Siraj Ahmed from Cavendish Maxwell:⁣“These individuals are not just seeking residences – they are investing in status symbols and unique ownership experiences.”⁣The Jeddah Tower project, which had been on pause since 2018, is back in motion with a projected completion date of 2028. The $26 billion development will house luxury residences, commercial space, a Four Seasons hotel, and a sky-high observation deck.⁣This wave of high-rise ambition reflects a deeper trend: real estate in the Gulf is no longer just about space — it’s about prestige, security, and long-term value.⁣Want to be part of the future skyline of the Middle East? Now’s the time to explore your investment options.⁣hashtag#MiddleEastRealEstate hashtag#SupertallTowers hashtag#JeddahTower hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#LuxuryInvestments hashtag#AziziDevelopments hashtag#GulfMegaProjects hashtag#GoldenVisa hashtag#RealEstateTrends hashtag#SkylineViews hashtag#UAEPropertyMarket hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#InvestInTheGulf hashtag#BurjAzizihashtag#Repost @thenationalnews

「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. Strong Population & Economic GrowthDubai is attracting global talent, wealthy individuals, and businessesPopulation grows by hundreds of thousands annually → High housing demand supports price appreciation and rental stability.4. World-Class Safety and StabilityRanked #2 in global safety (Numbeo 2024)Neutral and stable government, far from global conflicts → Dubai is seen as a safe haven for global wealth.5. Eligibility for Long-Term Residency (Golden Visa)Property investment of AED 2M or more qualifies for a 10-year Golden VisaEnables long-term residence, bank access, and family sponsorship6. Global Hub with Excellent ConnectivityDubai International Airport is one of the busiest in the worldEasy access to Europe, Asia, and Africa → Perfect for investors seeking international flexibility.7. Strong Currency Pegged to USDThe UAE Dirham (AED) is pegged to the US Dollar → Helps protect against currency depreciation and inflation, especially for investors from countries like Japan.🌟 In Summary:Zero taxes + high rental returns + global city with safety & growth → These factors make Dubai a top choice for international property investors.hashtag#ドバイ hashtag#ドバイ不動産 hashtag#不動産投資 hashtag#現地ドバイ不動産屋さん hashtag#世界中から人物が集まる場所hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Dubairealestate hashtag#Investment hashtag#Bridesandalliesrealestate

ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt

🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝙎𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙘𝙝 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝙊𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙨 & 𝙂𝙧𝙚𝙚𝙣𝙝𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝘽𝙤𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨Since my last work experience, I have embarked on an enriching journey that has instilled in me the invaluable lessons of humility, patience, resilience, and the courage to continuously acquire new knowledge within the dynamic technology industry.I would also really appreciate any support or referrals from my LinkedIn network! If you know of any opportunities or can introduce me to someone in your network, please reach out. It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

The demand for ultra-luxury homes in supertall towers across the Middle East is reaching new heights – literally.⁣From Dubai’s record-breaking skyscrapers to Saudi Arabia’s revival of the Jeddah Tower (set to be the world’s tallest at over 1,000 metres), ambitious mega-projects are reshaping the region’s skyline – and attracting investors from around the globe.⁣As Mirwais Azizi, founder and chairman of Azizi Developments, told The National:⁣“A lot of people want to have some property here in Dubai — from India, Arab countries … now the Europeans, a lot of them are purchasing here because of the security, good leadership, and the stable market.”⁣Dubai’s real estate boom continues to be fuelled by smart government policies such as:– Residency permits for retirees and remote workers– The expansion of the 10-year Golden Visa program– Diversification of the UAE economy, making it one of the region’s most attractive investment destinations⁣According to Siraj Ahmed from Cavendish Maxwell:⁣“These individuals are not just seeking residences – they are investing in status symbols and unique ownership experiences.”⁣The Jeddah Tower project, which had been on pause since 2018, is back in motion with a projected completion date of 2028. The $26 billion development will house luxury residences, commercial space, a Four Seasons hotel, and a sky-high observation deck.⁣This wave of high-rise ambition reflects a deeper trend: real estate in the Gulf is no longer just about space — it’s about prestige, security, and long-term value.⁣Want to be part of the future skyline of the Middle East? 「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. Strong Population & Economic GrowthDubai is attracting global talent, wealthy individuals, and businessesPopulation grows by hundreds of thousands annually → High housing demand supports price appreciation and rental stability.4. World-Class Safety and StabilityRanked #2 in global safety (Numbeo 2024)Neutral and stable government, far from global conflicts → Dubai is seen as a safe haven for global wealth.5. Eligibility for Long-Term Residency (Golden Visa)Property investment of AED 2M or more qualifies for a 10-year Golden VisaEnables long-term residence, bank access, and family sponsorship6. Global Hub with Excellent ConnectivityDubai International Airport is one of the busiest in the worldEasy access to Europe, Asia, and Africa → Perfect for investors seeking international flexibility.7. Strong Currency Pegged to USDThe UAE Dirham (AED) is pegged to the US Dollar → Helps protect against currency depreciation and inflation, especially for investors from countries like Japan.🌟 In Summary:Zero taxes + high rental returns + global city with safety & growth → These factors make Dubai a top choice for international property investors.hashtag#ドバイ hashtag#ドバイ不動産 hashtag#不動産投資 hashtag#現地ドバイ不動産屋さん hashtag#世界中から人物が集まる場所hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Dubairealestate hashtag#Investment hashtag#Bridesandalliesrealestate

ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt

🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

If you know of any opportunities or can introduce me to someone in your network, please reach out. It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

⚠️ 🚨  SCAM ALERT 🚨 ⚠️ Hiring Fraud Attempt!!!I've received an email from Emma Young <emma@pulsetreeplacement.com> claiming to be a Senior Recruiter at PulseTree Placement, which is pretending to be @PulseRecruitment. After reviewing the details, it became clear that this is a Scam Attempt.1️⃣ There is no company named PulseTree Placement on LinkedIn. Instead, there is Pulse Recruitment. This raised some eyebrows2️⃣ There is no Emma Young to be found in the "Meet the team" section of the website of Pulse Recruitment (https://lnkd.in/eFmZKC-V)3️⃣ The domain name of Pulse Recruitment doesn't correspond to that of Emma Young. 4️⃣ The email ended with this, "We respect your privacy. To be removed from our communication, click here to unsubscribe". I think this is an infected link that might give them access to your device. Please be aware of such emails and check the sources before you click any links.

The demand for ultra-luxury homes in supertall towers across the Middle East is reaching new heights – literally.⁣From Dubai’s record-breaking skyscrapers to Saudi Arabia’s revival of the Jeddah Tower (set to be the world’s tallest at over 1,000 metres), ambitious mega-projects are reshaping the region’s skyline – and attracting investors from around the globe.⁣As Mirwais Azizi, founder and chairman of Azizi Developments, told The National:⁣“A lot of people want to have some property here in Dubai — from India, Arab countries … now the Europeans, a lot of them are purchasing here because of the security, good leadership, and the stable market.”⁣Dubai’s real estate boom continues to be fuelled by smart government policies such as:– Residency permits for retirees and remote workers– The expansion of the 10-year Golden Visa program– Diversification of the UAE economy, making it one of the region’s most attractive investment destinations⁣According to Siraj Ahmed from Cavendish Maxwell:⁣“These individuals are not just seeking residences – they are investing in status symbols and unique ownership experiences.”⁣The Jeddah Tower project, which had been on pause since 2018, is back in motion with a projected completion date of 2028. The $26 billion development will house luxury residences, commercial space, a Four Seasons hotel, and a sky-high observation deck.⁣This wave of high-rise ambition reflects a deeper trend: real estate in the Gulf is no longer just about space — it’s about prestige, security, and long-term value.⁣Want to be part of the future skyline of the Middle East? 🌟 HumAns: Are Your HR Policies Compliant & Accessible? 🌟Question: "What are the rules around having HR policies in an organization, and how should they be shared with employees?"The Short Answer: Under UAE labor laws, employers must have clear HR policies in place and ensure all employees have access to them. Here’s what you need to know:✅ Key Requirements:Mandatory Policies - Every company must document core policies like leave, termination, code of conduct, anti-discrimination, health & safety, and grievance procedures. These should align with UAE Labor Law (Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021) and any free zone regulations (if applicable).Accessibility - Policies must be communicated to all employees, ideally in writing (e.g., employee handbook, digital portal, or contract annex).New hires should acknowledge receipt (e.g., via email or signed document).Transparency & Updates - Any policy changes must be shared in advance, and employees should be notified (e.g., via email or internal announcements). Avoid vague language; policies should be clear, specific, and enforceable.👉 Pro Tip: Regularly review policies to ensure they stay updated with UAE labor law amendments!🚀 Need Help?If your organization doesn’t have HR policies in place yet—or needs a compliance review—speak to HumLog today! We’ll help you draft, implement, and communicate policies seamlessly.Got another HR question? 「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. Strong Population & Economic GrowthDubai is attracting global talent, wealthy individuals, and businessesPopulation grows by hundreds of thousands annually → High housing demand supports price appreciation and rental stability.4. World-Class Safety and StabilityRanked #2 in global safety (Numbeo 2024)Neutral and stable government, far from global conflicts → Dubai is seen as a safe haven for global wealth.5. Eligibility for Long-Term Residency (Golden Visa)Property investment of AED 2M or more qualifies for a 10-year Golden VisaEnables long-term residence, bank access, and family sponsorship6. Global Hub with Excellent ConnectivityDubai International Airport is one of the busiest in the worldEasy access to Europe, Asia, and Africa → Perfect for investors seeking international flexibility.7. Strong Currency Pegged to USDThe UAE Dirham (AED) is pegged to the US Dollar → Helps protect against currency depreciation and inflation, especially for investors from countries like Japan.🌟 In Summary:Zero taxes + high rental returns + global city with safety & growth → These factors make Dubai a top choice for international property investors.hashtag#ドバイ hashtag#ドバイ不動産 hashtag#不動産投資 hashtag#現地ドバイ不動産屋さん hashtag#世界中から人物が集まる場所hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Dubairealestate hashtag#Investment hashtag#Bridesandalliesrealestate

ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt

🇦🇪United Arab Emirates: A Model of Development Assistance from the Global South The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is reshaping the landscape of development assistance and philanthropy, offering a compelling model for Overseas Development Assistance (ODA) at a time when aid from traditional donors—such as the U.S. and Europe—is declining. The UAE consistently ranks among the most active nations in ODA relative to GDP, prioritizing debt-free, long-term capital mobilization with a strong focus on South-South and regional cooperation. In February, the UAE announced a landmark $40 billion investment in Italy, targeting sectors like artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and strategic infrastructure. This investment also supports Italy’s Mattei Plan for Africa, which aims to drive economic development, professional training, and food and energy security across the continent. Beyond strategic investments, the UAE places a strong emphasis on human capital development—empowering youth through cutting-edge education, digital skills training, employment opportunities, and leadership development. Humanitarian and emergency relief for conflict-affected and displaced populations also remain a core priority. Just in the last few days, His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE, launched two new powerful initiatives at a critical time for global education, youth resilience, and humanitarian aid, in addition to the current engagement of the Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nayan Foundation on youth entrepreneurship, education and health sectors: ✔️ Zayed Education Foundation: Aims to empower 100,000 future leaders by 2035 through tertiary education, research, and innovation—starting in the UAE and expanding across Arab countries. ✔️ Mohamed bin Zayed Foundation for Humanity: Will deliver humanitarian relief and development assistance to vulnerable communities worldwide. (https://lnkd.in/dsVJGhdn)🔹 GLC Global Consulting provided strategic development advice for UAE human capital programming. Our expertise also lies in strengthening implementation mechanisms, driving results, and supporting evidence-based impact on the ground. Given the scale and expected impact of these initiatives, robust monitoring and evaluation systems will be essential to ensure that funding aligns with measurable outcomes. This will also promote transparency, learning, and knowledge-sharing across the global development community. 📖 A must read: From Financing to Investing for Development: The End of Overseas Development Assistance as We Know It by Ferid Belhaj (Former VP, World Bank Middle East and North Africa) via Policycenter.ma. --a timely reflection on this paradigm shift.hashtag#UAE hashtag#ODA hashtag#GLCConsulting hashtag#ZayedEducation hashtag#ImpactDriven hashtag#YouthEmpowerment hashtag#GlobalDevelopment hashtag#AfDB hashtag#InnovationInAid hashtag#KhalifaBinZayedalNahyan hashtag#PolicyCenterforthenewSouth

𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝙎𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙘𝙝 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝙊𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙨 & 𝙂𝙧𝙚𝙚𝙣𝙝𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙅𝙤𝙗 𝘽𝙤𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨Since my last work experience, I have embarked on an enriching journey that has instilled in me the invaluable lessons of humility, patience, resilience, and the courage to continuously acquire new knowledge within the dynamic technology industry.I would also really appreciate any support or referrals from my LinkedIn network! If you know of any opportunities or can introduce me to someone in your network, please reach out. It would mean a lot to me.Here are two techniques that have helped me uncover new roles across different web-apps and sites using this tool-set:1. 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀• AND: Connects terms (e.g., “Software Developer AND Financial Services”)• OR: Broadens to either term (e.g., “Business Development OR Account Executive OR Account Manager”)• NOT (or the minus sign “-”): Excludes terms (e.g., “Developer NOT internship”)Example syntax:(“asset management” OR “infrastructure” OR “wind asset management” OR “infrastructure asset management” OR “infrastructure developer”)AND (wind OR renewables)AND ("English" OR "Spanish" OR "German")NOT (IT OR “information technology” OR ”IT Infrastructure”)2. 𝐇𝐚𝐜𝐤: 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐛 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐯𝐢𝐚 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐠𝐥𝐞If you’re searching for roles on Greenhouse (a popular hiring platform), try this shortcut:<𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐓𝐢𝐭𝐥𝐞> <𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧> 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨Example:𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐋𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐧 𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞:𝐡𝐭𝐭𝐩𝐬://𝐣𝐨𝐛-𝐛𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬.𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐧𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞.𝐢𝐨You’ll see specific listings from companies that use Greenhouse—often ones you’d miss by scrolling aimlessly on general boards.

Since childhood, I have been fascinated by skyscrapers, and Dubai’s rapid real estate growth continues to captivate me. This led me to compare Dubai’s market with Mumbai’s.📈 Annual Capital Appreciation: Dubai experiences 5-8% annual growth, outpacing London and New York, while Mumbai stands at 4-5%. Luxury and high-end properties in Dubai offer strong capital appreciation.🏡 Tax Benefits: Unlike India, where rental income is taxed at 20-30%, Dubai imposes no rental income tax, capital gains tax, or property tax. However, Indian investors must still declare and pay taxes on their Dubai rental income and capital gains in India.💰 Rental Yield & Affordability: Dubai offers high rental yields, with some properties generating enough income to cover mortgage payments—a rarity in Mumbai, London, or New York. The highest rental yields (8-10%) come from mid-range ($300K-$800K) and affordable (<$270K) properties.⚠️ Potential Risks:Oversupply concerns: A surge in property developments could cause prices to drop, similar to China’s ghost cities or the 2008 U.S. housing crash.Economic dependencies: Dubai’s economy is pegged to the U.S. dollar, making it susceptible to global recessions.Strict loan systems: Financing for foreign investors can be challenging.📊 Market Indicators:Residents Per Unit Built: Dubai (2.72) vs. Mumbai (4.5-5), highlighting Mumbai’s higher population amid limited supply.Housing Absorption Rate: Dubai stands at an impressive 89%, with some luxury properties reaching 95%.Affordability: The price-to-income ratio suggests Dubai remains relatively affordable compared to Mumbai.🌍 Strong Demand & FDI: Dubai’s real estate market continues to attract significant foreign direct investment (FDI), particularly from Russian, European, and Indian investors. Regulations in UAE is balancing the supply and demand effectively right now.What are your thoughts?hashtag#Dubai hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#MumbaiRealestate hashtag#Mumbai

The demand for ultra-luxury homes in supertall towers across the Middle East is reaching new heights – literally.⁣From Dubai’s record-breaking skyscrapers to Saudi Arabia’s revival of the Jeddah Tower (set to be the world’s tallest at over 1,000 metres), ambitious mega-projects are reshaping the region’s skyline – and attracting investors from around the globe.⁣As Mirwais Azizi, founder and chairman of Azizi Developments, told The National:⁣“A lot of people want to have some property here in Dubai — from India, Arab countries … now the Europeans, a lot of them are purchasing here because of the security, good leadership, and the stable market.”⁣Dubai’s real estate boom continues to be fuelled by smart government policies such as:– Residency permits for retirees and remote workers– The expansion of the 10-year Golden Visa program– Diversification of the UAE economy, making it one of the region’s most attractive investment destinations⁣According to Siraj Ahmed from Cavendish Maxwell:⁣“These individuals are not just seeking residences – they are investing in status symbols and unique ownership experiences.”⁣The Jeddah Tower project, which had been on pause since 2018, is back in motion with a projected completion date of 2028. The $26 billion development will house luxury residences, commercial space, a Four Seasons hotel, and a sky-high observation deck.⁣This wave of high-rise ambition reflects a deeper trend: real estate in the Gulf is no longer just about space — it’s about prestige, security, and long-term value.⁣Want to be part of the future skyline of the Middle East? Now’s the time to explore your investment options.⁣hashtag#MiddleEastRealEstate hashtag#SupertallTowers hashtag#JeddahTower hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#LuxuryInvestments hashtag#AziziDevelopments hashtag#GulfMegaProjects hashtag#GoldenVisa hashtag#RealEstateTrends hashtag#SkylineViews hashtag#UAEPropertyMarket hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#InvestInTheGulf hashtag#BurjAzizihashtag#Repost @thenationalnews

Dubai vs. Abu Dhabi: Battle of the Emirates!🇦🇪Which is the Ultimate Incentive Event Destination?When it comes to hosting an unforgettable events, both Dubai and Abu Dhabi offer world-class luxury, unique experiences, and stunning backdrops. But which one is the right choice for your team? 🌟 HumAns: Are Your HR Policies Compliant & Accessible? 🌟Question: "What are the rules around having HR policies in an organization, and how should they be shared with employees?"The Short Answer: Under UAE labor laws, employers must have clear HR policies in place and ensure all employees have access to them. Here’s what you need to know:✅ Key Requirements:Mandatory Policies - Every company must document core policies like leave, termination, code of conduct, anti-discrimination, health & safety, and grievance procedures. These should align with UAE Labor Law (Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021) and any free zone regulations (if applicable).Accessibility - Policies must be communicated to all employees, ideally in writing (e.g., employee handbook, digital portal, or contract annex).New hires should acknowledge receipt (e.g., via email or signed document).Transparency & Updates - Any policy changes must be shared in advance, and employees should be notified (e.g., via email or internal announcements). Avoid vague language; policies should be clear, specific, and enforceable.👉 Pro Tip: Regularly review policies to ensure they stay updated with UAE labor law amendments!🚀 Need Help?If your organization doesn’t have HR policies in place yet—or needs a compliance review—speak to HumLog today! We’ll help you draft, implement, and communicate policies seamlessly.Got another HR question? Drop it below! 👇 hashtag#HumAns hashtag#UAELaborLaw hashtag#HRPolicies hashtag#WorkplaceCompliance hashtag#AskHumLog

Staying in Dubai, a place with some of the best ultra-luxury hotels and resorts in the world, can be an expensive undertaking. But it doesn't have to be. I've always been a fan of a good, clean, affordable hotel (after all, who can really afford to live in five-star luxury every holiday?), and I've selected eleven of the best in Dubai for Condé Nast Traveller Middle East. Some have been here a while, others are brand new. Some have rooftop pools, others have beach access. Some have traditional Arabian architecture, others are in shiny towers. Some are filled with art, others are dog- and cat-friendly. Some are fairly well known, others you may never have heard of. And some of them have low-season starting rates from just US$ 54 per night. Yes, really. 「なぜドバイに投資するのか？」最近日本の有名YouTuberも取り上げたように日本でもここ数年で有名になってきたドバイについて、投資目線でのメリットを簡単にまとめてみました。世界中の投資家が集まる理由はこの７つです🌏🇦🇪 ドバイに投資する7つのメリット① 税金がほぼゼロ個人所得税なし不動産の保有税なしキャピタルゲイン税なし → 賃貸収入や売却益をほぼそのまま利益として受け取れる。② 高い家賃利回り世界的に見ても高水準（年間グロスで6〜10%が一般的）東京やシンガポールの2〜3倍の収益性 → キャッシュフロー重視の投資家に人気③ 人口増加と経済成長が続く国際都市世界中から富裕層・企業・移住者が集まる年間数十万人単位で人口増加 → 住宅需要が高く、価格と家賃が安定的に上昇④ 世界トップレベルの安全性世界2位の治安（Numbeo調査）政治的にも中立性が高く、紛争や暴動とは無縁 → 資産の**「逃避先」や「分散先」**としても安心⑤ 長期滞在ビザ（ゴールデンビザ）が取れるAED 2M（約8,200万円）以上の不動産投資で10年ビザ取得可銀行口座・居住・法人設立も簡単に可能に⑥ 世界有数のハブ都市（アクセス抜群）ドバイ国際空港は世界トップの国際旅客数欧州・アジア・アフリカへの移動が便利 → 投資とライフスタイルの両立が可能⑦ 外貨建て資産としての魅力（AEDはUSDペッグ）ドバイの通貨（AED）は米ドルと連動 → 円安・インフレ対策としても有効🌟まとめ税金ゼロ＋高利回り＋安全＋世界的成長都市 → これが、ドバイが世界中の投資家から注目されている理由です！！ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー🇦🇪 7 Key Benefits of Investing in Dubai1. Tax-Free AdvantageNo personal income taxNo property ownership taxNo capital gains tax → You can keep almost 100% of your rental income and profit from property sales.2. High Rental YieldsAmong the highest in the world (typically 6–10% annually)2–3 times higher than cities like Tokyo or Singapore → Ideal for investors focused on strong cash flow.3. Strong Population & Economic GrowthDubai is attracting global talent, wealthy individuals, and businessesPopulation grows by hundreds of thousands annually → High housing demand supports price appreciation and rental stability.4. World-Class Safety and StabilityRanked #2 in global safety (Numbeo 2024)Neutral and stable government, far from global conflicts → Dubai is seen as a safe haven for global wealth.5. Eligibility for Long-Term Residency (Golden Visa)Property investment of AED 2M or more qualifies for a 10-year Golden VisaEnables long-term residence, bank access, and family sponsorship6. Global Hub with Excellent ConnectivityDubai International Airport is one of the busiest in the worldEasy access to Europe, Asia, and Africa → Perfect for investors seeking international flexibility.7. Strong Currency Pegged to USDThe UAE Dirham (AED) is pegged to the US Dollar → Helps protect against currency depreciation and inflation, especially for investors from countries like Japan.🌟 In Summary:Zero taxes + high rental returns + global city with safety & growth → These factors make Dubai a top choice for international property investors.hashtag#ドバイ hashtag#ドバイ不動産 hashtag#不動産投資 hashtag#現地ドバイ不動産屋さん hashtag#世界中から人物が集まる場所hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Dubairealestate hashtag#Investment hashtag#Bridesandalliesrealestate

ငါတို့နိုင်ငံမှာ နည်းပညာကျောင်းကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါပြီး အင်ဂျင်နီယာပညာကို တကယ်ဝါသနာပါလို့ - Engineer တစ်ယောက်ရှိရမဲ့ Ethics တွေနဲ့ တကယ်တော်တဲ့ အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေရှိပါတယ်။ ငါတို့ဟာ ငါတို့ပညာတွေကို အပြည့်အဝ အသုံးပြုခွင့် မရခဲ့တာပါ။ ခေါင်မိုးက မလုံတော့ တခြားလေဒဏ် မိုးဒဏ်ကို မခံနိုင်သလိုပဲ - မြန်မာပြည်က Construction Community ထဲက တာဝန်ရှိသူတွေကိုယ်တိုင်က အဂတိလှိုက်လှိုက်ကြီး စားခဲ့တော့ငါတို့လုပ်ငန်းခွင်တွေမှာလည်း ..... - Project Managers တွေက သူတို့ကိုယ်ပိုင် ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို ထည့်ထားလို့ QC တွေက စစ်မရ ပြုမရတာ ကြည့်မလား?- Project Engineer တွေက လုပ်ငန်းရှာပေးတဲ့အတွက် % တွေမျှယူလို့ ကန်ထရိုက်တွေကို QC တွေက စစ်ရင် ကန်ထရိုက်ဘက်ကပါပြီး ပဋိပက္ခဖြစ်ရတာကြည့်မလား?- Site Engineer နှင့် ကန်ထရိုက်ပေါင်းပြီး QC တွေကို Project Engineer တွေနဲ့ တိုက်တာကြည့်မလား?- QC ကိုယ်တိုင်က လာဘ်ပေးလာဘ်ယူနဲ့ Neglected လုပ်တာတွေကြည့်မလား?အင်ဂျင်နီယာလောကမှာ "မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန်နှင့် ဂုဏ်သိက္ခာရှိရှိ ကိုယ့်ပညာကို တကယ်အသုံးချဖို့ ကြိုးစားတဲ့ ရိုးသားတဲ့သူမှန်သမျှက" နောက်ဆုံးမှာ အများနဲ့တစ်ယောက်မို့ သိုးမည်းတွေဖြစ်သွားပြီး လူ့အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းက ဝိုင်းကြဉ်တဲ့ လူ့ကန့်ကောင် ဖြစ်သွားရတာချည်းပဲ။ ဒီနိုင်ငံမှာ Quality Control Engineer ဆိုတာ For show သက်သက်မျှသာပဲ။ တကယ်က Quality Control Engineer က  Factual ကျကျ အလုပ်လုပ်ပြီဆို ရှိသမျှ Project Managers - Project Engineers - Site Engineers တွေရဲ့ တိုက်ခိုက်ခြင်းကို ခံရတော့တာပါပဲ။ "ရေလိုက်ငါးလိုက် မနေတတ်တဲ့ကောင် လူကြိုက်နည်းတဲ့ကောင် ဖြစ်တော့တာပါပဲ။" ဒီလိုနဲ့ပဲ (၁၀)စုနှစ် တစ်ခုစာကို အမျိုးမျိုးအဖုံဖုံ ဖြတ်သန်းလာရင်း ... Construction လောကပါးတောင် ဝ နေပြီ။ ဘယ်သူ့နှုတ်က ဘာစကား ထွက်လာရင် ဘယ်လမ်းကြောင်းကို ဦးတည်နေတယ်ဆိုတာကအစ ....။တခါတလေလည်း ငါတို့ပညာတွေ အရာမထင်တာက မြန်မာနိုင်ငံမလို့ကို ဖြစ်တာပါလို့လည်း တွေးမိတယ်။ နိုင်ငံကိုယ်တိုင်ကိုက ပညာရှင်အားမ‌ပေးတဲ့ နိုင်ငံဆိုတော့ ..... လုပ်ငန်းရှင်တွေက အရင်းရှင်ဆန်တာလည်း မဆန်းပါဘူး တွေးမိရပါတယ်။ Managing Director တွေ - Project Director တွေ - Board of Directors တွေ ကိုယ်တိုင်က ကိုယ်နားမလည်တဲ့ Techniqucal တွေကိုလည်း စွက်ဖက်မယ်။ လုပ်ပိုင်ခွင့်လည်း မပေးဘူး။ ပေါတာနဲ့ ချောင်တာပဲ လိုချင်တဲ့အခါလည်း .... ငါတို့ပညာတွေက အလကားဖြစ်သွားပြန်တယ်။မြန်မာပြည်က အင်ဂျင်နီယာဖြစ်ဖို့ ရွေးချယ်ခဲ့မိတာကိုက ငါတို့ရဲ့ မတော်တဆအမှားလားလို့ တွေးမိတဲ့အထိပဲ။--ဘာပဲဖြစ်ဖြစ် ကိုယ့်ပညာဝမ်းစာကိုတော့ ဖြည့်ရမယ်။ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ ပညာကို တန်ဖိုးထားတဲ့ အသိုင်းအဝိုင်းတစ်ခု ရှိလာနိုင်မှာပါဆိုတဲ့ မျှော်လင့်ချက်နဲ့ ..... မမှန်ကန်တာ‌တွေပဲ အမြဲမြင်နေရရင်တောင် မှန်ကန်တဲ့အရာတွေကိုတော့ မေ့လိုက်လို့မဖြစ်ဘူးလေ။ hashtag#Earthquakehashtag#Myanmarhashtag#Survive_Guilt
